div.l: That as an horse he fnorteth in his slepe
Ne of his tayle byhynde he toke no kepe
His wyf bare hym a burthon̄ a full stronge
Men̄ myght her͗e Rowtynge her͗e a Furlong
The wenche routeth eke ꝑpar company
Aleyn̄ the clerke that herd this company
He powked on Iohn and seid slepust þᵘou
Herde þᵘou eủer such a song or now
Lo which a cowplynge ys bytwyxe hem alle
A wylde fyre on theyre bodyes Falle
Who herd eủer such a ferly thynge
Ye þey schull haue the floᵘur of euel endynge
This longe nyȝte þ̉er tydeth me no rest
But yette no forse all schall be for the best
For Iohn seyd he as mote y eủer thryve
Yf þat y may yondʳer wenche wol y swyve
Som̄e Esement hath lawe schapen̄ us
For Iohn þ̉er ys a lawe that seith þus
That yf a man̄ in one poynte be greved
That in a noþ̉er he schall be releved
Oure corne sothely ys stolen̄ hit ys no nay
And we haue had an yvel Fytte to day
And syth I schal haue non̄e amendement
Agayne my losse y woll haue Esement
By god hit schal none oþ̉er be
This Iohn answerd Aleyn̄ avyse the
The myller ys a ꝑperylouse man̄ he seid
And yf þᵗat he oute of his slepe abreyde
He myght doon̄ us both a vyleny
Alayn̄ answerd I kounte hit nought a flye
And up he Ryseth and by the wenche he crepte
This wenche lay upright and fast slepte
Tyll he so nyȝe was or sche woke ⁊and myȝte aspie
That hit had ben̄ to late for to crye ·
